intro: Linanthus viscainensis, commonly known as the viscous linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Evening Primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus viscainensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
